body_html: The problem remains. XLA compilation doesn't respond to tensorflow.Session.run timeouts. Also it seems to only use one thread for the build process. I got around this by launching a new process per experiment and killing it myself on timeouts.
body_text: The problem remains. XLA compilation doesn't respond to tensorflow.Session.run timeouts. Also it seems to only use one thread for the build process. I got around this by launching a new process per experiment and killing it myself on timeouts.
body: The problem remains. XLA compilation doesn't respond to tensorflow.Session.run timeouts. Also it seems to only use one thread for the build process. I got around this by launching a new process per experiment and killing it myself on timeouts.
